data.meta_description: Antiquarian books for bibliophiles - out of print books, rare books, modern firsts, second-hand books, book collectors, bibliophily.
data.text:
ANDERSON, POUL:

STRANGERS FROM EARTH - 8 TALES. [483K.]

Imprint: USA.NEW YORK,BALLANTINE BOOKS,1961.

Edition: US,12mo paperback original,p/b 1st edn.

Binding: Paperback/wraps., No dw/dj,p/back as issued.

Inscription: Not SIGNED.

US,12mo paperback original,p/back 1st edn. A Ballantine original,(483K),and 1st edn thus.Paperback original denotes the first format and its first appearance in print of the book.Paperbacks usually follow on from the HB edn,but can be published at the same time as the HB edn,but p/back originals are published prior to any other book format.] NFINE.No owner inscrptn,no previous bookseller's inked price,other than a British price (2/6) by way of a small,b/w adhesive label affixed towards the top right-hand corner's edges on front cover, and no price removal to spine - stated An Original BB.Bright,crisp,clean,glossy, sharp-cornered,colour pictorial cover art by Richard Powers,illustrated front with black lettering,white spine with orange+ b/w lettering and NO reading creases to same,rear cover with red+white lettered publisher's b/w photographic advert; with negligible shelf-wear, bumping,creasing to edges and corners - no nicks.tears or splits present.All edges orange with some minimal blemishes; contents bright,tight, clean,solid and sound - no dog-ear reading creases to any pages' corners - unread, apart from my own collation.US,12mo paperback original,p/b 1st edn,5-144pp [paginated] includes 8 stories by Anderson collected from period 1951 to 1957 as varied as 'Earthman,Beware','Quixote and the Windmill','Gypsy','For the Duration', 'Duek on Syrtis','The Star Beast','The Disintegrating Sky' and 'Among Thieves'. Please contact seller,because of the lighter weight of this item for correct shipping/P+p quotes - particularly ALL overseas customers - BEFORE ordering through the order page! ** N.B. UK,buyers please note,p/backs' actual shipping/P+p costs are adjusted and any difference is refunded,after order receipt and BEFORE the order's despatch, especially if p/back is offered P/p free. ** N.B. US customers please be aware: US standard AIR postage from UK to US can now cost more than the price of the book! If speed is not of the essence,then Economy rate is recommended - at approx. 2/3rds of standard US AIR quote/rate - sometimes arriving long before the quoted 42 days - but not always.

Anderson, Poul

THE HIGH CRUSADE

Imprint: Corgi, 1981

Binding: Paperback

In the year of grace 1345, as Sir Roger Baron de Tourneville is gathering a n army to join King Edward III in the war against France, a most astonishin g event occurs: a huge silver ship descends through the sky and lands in a pasture beside the little village of Ansby in North East Lincolnshire. The Wersgorix, whose scouting ship it is, are quite expert at taking over plane ts, and having determined from orbit that this one was suitable, they initi ate standard world-conquering procedure. But this time it's no mere primiti ves the Wersgorix seek to enslave - they've launched their invasion against Englishmen! In the end, only one alien is left alive - and Sir Roger's gra nd vision is born. He intends for the creature to fly the ship first to Fra nce to aid his King, then on to the Holy Land to vanquish the infidel!, Good

Stock number: RWARE0000031057. ISBN: 9780552117067

Bookseller's details and sales conditions: Infinity Books Japan

¥ 500.00 (approx. $US 4.55 )

Anderson, Poul

THE TIME PATROL The Full Chronicles of the Patrol - Including the All-New Novel Star of the Sea

Imprint: Tor Books, 1994

Edition: First Edition

Binding: Softcover

Light wear to corners, a little scuffing. Upper back edge & last few pages have a small rough/creased edge, and tiny tear to cover in that area. Interior clean & unmarked. Includes: . Time Patrol, Brave to Be a King, Gibraltar Falls, The Only Game in Town, Delenda Est, Ivory and Apes and Peacocks, The Sorrow of Odin the Great, Star of the Sea, The Year of the Ransom. "The capacity for time travel has made human history a fragile thing. To protect the continuity of that history and guard humanity's mysterious destiny, the men and woman of our own future have established the Time Patrol, a far-flung organization dedicated to preserving the timelines and foiling the attempts of those who would change history to suit their own purposes...." ; 8vo; 458 pages, Near Fine

Stock number: 6770. ISBN: 0312856369

Bookseller's details and sales conditions: Riverwoods Books

$US 11.50

ANDERSON**, POUL:

THE WAR OF THE WING-MEN. [ACE G-634.]

Imprint: US.NEW YORL,NY.ACE BOOKS,INC.,1958.

Edition: US,small 12mo p/back,1st edn.

Binding: Paperback., No dw/dj,p/b as issued.

Inscription: Not SIGNED.

US,small 12mo p/back,1st edn.VG.No owner inscrptn and no price removal (50c) from cover.Bright clean,colour pictorial artwork by Ed Emsh,illustrated front cover with red+yellow letters,black and black outlined yellow letters to spine which has some reading creases and slight rubbing with miniscule loss of part of ACE logo,at head of spine.Negligible shelf-wear, bumping,creasing to edges and corners,no nicks,tears or splits present.Sharp front two corners,rear two corners lightly creased.Top+fore-edges coloured but aged/ toned,bottom edges brighter and cleaner; contents bright,tight,clean and solid,one pp23/4 with top corner crease - no other pages affected.US,small 12mo p/back,1st edn,5-160pp [paginated] includes XXII (22) chapters; plus [unpaginated] story blurb, and title page. A problem adventure story,in which three Terrans - a space pilot,a planetary queen, and a hulk of a tycoon - crash on the sea- world Diomedes,in the midst of a bitter war between two winged races,one of seamen,the other of migrant cattle-raisers.Their food supply won't last,they can't eat Diomedean food,and they have to get to Earth's lone trading post on the other side of the planet before they starve. How his is done is the plot,and Poul Anderson pours in the complications and action as he know how to do,but the thing that gives the story stature is the gradually emerging portrait of Nicholas van Rijn,the 'man who counts.' Please contact seller,because of the lighter weight/value of this item for correct shipping/P+p quotes - particularly ALL overseas customers - BEFORE ordering through the order page! ** UK,buyers please note,p/backs' actual shipping/P+p costs are adjusted and any difference is refunded,after order receipt and before the order's despatch,especially if p/back is offered P/p free. ** N.B. US customers please be aware: US standard AIR postage from UK to US can now cost more than the price of the book! If speed is not of the essence,then Economy rate is recommended - at approx. 2/3rds of standard US AIR quote/rate - sometimes arriving long before the quoted 42 days - but not always.

Bookseller's details and sales conditions: R. J. A. PAXTON-DENNY

£ 7.99 (approx. $US 10.40 )

ANDERSON**, POUL:

Trader to the Stars.

Imprint: LONDON.PANTHER BOOKS LTD.,1967.

Edition: UK,slim 12mo p/back,1st edn.

Binding: Paperback., No dw/dj,p/b as issued.

Inscription: Not SIGNED.

UK,slim 12mo p/back,1st edn.[Originally, first published US,(NY)DOUBLEDAY,1964 and first US p/b,Berkeley(NY),September 1966. First UK 8vo HB+dw/dj,GOLLANCZ (London), 1965 and first UK p/b,PANTHER (London), 1967 - this edn.Much of the content appeared in 'Astounding Science Fiction', 1956 (Street & Smith Publications) and in 'Analog Science Fact - Science Fiction' (Conde Nast,1961-4) - check my SCIENCE FICTION & FANTASY catalogue for examples.] VG.No owner inscrptn,and no price removal to cover.Bright,clean,colour illustrated front with black,white - the majority - letters,white letters to spine and red+black lettered rear cover; with some shelf-wear, rubbing and creasing to edges and corners - no major nicks,tears or splits present.Some miniscule loss due to rubbing to rear panel's spine's edges.All edges aged/toned; contents bright,tight, clean with minimal page-edge toning but no dog-ear reading creases to any pages' corners.UK,slim 12mo p/back,1st edn,9- 144pp [paginated] includes 3 story collection; plus [unpaginated] critics' reviews(2) title page,acknowledgements, prose extract - Le Matelog. A part of the 'Technic Civilization: Polesotechnic' series of books.A collection of 3 novellas in the 'Nicholas Van Rijn' series of books:- Hiding Place.','Territory.','The Master Key.' The constant cargo of the star traders is danger.Their space-yacht,pursued by angry Adderkops thirsting for their blood,has run into serious engine trouble.Picking up the trail of another alien spaceship,they decide to board it and force its crew to take them home.But once aboard,it's not so easy to find the crew: they're faced with cages of bizarre,other-worldly animals: Tiger- Apes,Elephantoids,Gorilloids, Catterpiggles,Helmet Beasts,and Tentacle Centaurs. One set of these extraordinary creatures must be the crew,in hiding.But which? Survival depends on you finding the right answer.And this is just the first of the problems facing Poul Anderson's intrepid space-merchant venturers. Please contact seller,because of the lighter weight of this item for correct shipping/P+p quotes - particularly ALL overseas customers - BEFORE ordering through the order page! ** UK,buyers please note,p/backs' actual shipping/P+p costs are adjusted and any difference is refunded,after order receipt and before the order's despatch,especially if p/back is offered P/p free. ** N.B. US customers please be aware: US standard AIR postage from UK to US can now cost more than the price of the book! If speed is not of the essence,then Economy rate is recommended - at approx. 2/3rds of standard US AIR quote/rate - sometimes arriving long before the quoted 42 days - but not always.

ANDERSON Poul

Twilight World

Imprint: London, Gollancz, 1962

Edition: First Edition

Binding: Hardback , With Dust Jacket

8vo - over 7? - 9? tall. EX-LIBRARY. cancelled stamps to front pastedown, end paper and the rear end paper. rear endpaper also has a library rules plate pasted on. reference number stamped to the endpaper, half title and title, as well as a large stamp across the title page. pp 22 has a 60mm tear along the spine margin not affecting text and pp 131 has a stamp along the fore edge margin, tape residue to endpapers and top and bottom of boards. DW is unclipped but has the bottom margin trimmed losing the Gollancz at the tail but not any text from the front or rear panels. A little tape residue to the edges of the fold ins, and has remains of crimped paper on the back of the top and bottom edges from a library protective cover. A serviceable copy.. Ex-Library. Book Condition: Good. Binding: Hard Cover. Jacket: Good

Stock number: 000391.

Bookseller's details and sales conditions: Fortuna Books

$NZ 25.00 (approx. $US 18.36 )
